item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:64, topic:344424”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=440803.msg3962229#msg3962229 date=1333398325]

go home all beat this

Completed 10000 tasks in an average 5ms on 1 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 4ms on 2 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 5ms on 3 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 5ms on 4 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 7ms on 5 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 2ms on 6 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 6ms on 7 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 6ms on 8 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 6ms on 9 threads with 100 tests each.
Completed 10000 tasks in an average 6ms on 10 threads with 100 tests each.

Don’t tell me that you have 12GB RAM because you think it makes your computer faster…Honestly rip that 8GB out and leave 4Gb, that’s all you need.

I asked a gaming laptop, shop guy gave me one
at least he didn’t lie, every game runs smoothly on highest graphics
[/quote]
LMFAO, you got ripped.[/quote]
Nope, since I didn’t have any problems with it, runs smoothly,
I redid the points test after almost a year, and didnt lose any yet.
Was also only 990$

i always run a shitload of applications at once, so the more ram the better
[/quote]
You honestly don’t need more than 4GB, 6-8GB at very maximum. I have 4GB and I’ve never ran out of it and I do lots of things at once.[/quote]
Yeah, with 8GB I’ve never even gotten upwards of 4GB usage. The processor is definitely more important.
